value.title: Power BI Administration
value.excerpt: This list includes all things related to administering Power BI. This includes dealing with licenses, working with Azure Active Directory and Office 365 and account issues.

topItems.title: Power BI Premium: What is V-CORE pooling?!?
topItems.excerpt: Adam breaks down v-core pooling with Power BI Premium. Explaining where the v-cores come from and how creating a Power BI Premium node affects the v-core pool.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

This consists of two potential roles within Azure Active Directory or Office 365.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

topItems.excerpt: Learn how you can block free signups for the Power BI service. Free signups are also what are referred to as viral signups. This action can affect more than just Power BI, so be careful.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 1 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you manage a Power BI tenant? How do you configure tenant settings, monitor usage, and provision licenses and other organizational resources? This learning path covers typical tasks and tools, such as the Power BI admin portal and Office 365 admin center. You will learn how to establish and provide governance for a Power BI environment and provision Power BI Premium capacity.

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

topItems.title: Facilitate collaboration and sharing in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to collaborate and share dashboards and reports with coworkers.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Premium, Power BI embedded, automation
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you foster collaboration and share Power BI outputs? How do you monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, and automate administration? This course will demonstrate how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources. You’ll learn how to establish a data access infrastructure and how to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant. Finally, you’ll learn how to automate common tasks with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: Power BI administrators manage every aspect of their tenant. This learning path covers advanced administrative tasks, such as fostering collaboration and sharing data. You will earn how to monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, broaden the reach of Power BI, and automate administration with APIs and PowerShell cmdlets.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer’s needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not “click the buttons” during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.
This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
Discovering customer needs.
Proposing a solution.
Working with requirements.
Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Microsoft Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

topItems.title: Improving format of DAX code by using DAX Studio
topItems.excerpt: If it is not formatted... it is not DAX! Use DAX Formatter in DAX Studio and improve your formulas in Power BI! How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

topItems.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
topItems.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

topItems.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Refresh and NO DATA in my Power BI visuals???
value.excerpt: Have you published your Power BI report to the service, refresh the data, and the visuals go blank? Patrick may have an answer for you.  Troubleshooting refresh scenarios https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/refresh-troubleshooting-refresh-scenarios  Data types in Power BI Desktop https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/desktop-data-types

value.title: Use this Power BI feature to display custom message or titles

value.title: Why can't Power BI connect to my cloud source???
value.excerpt: You have a cloud data source like Azure SQL Database. Why can't Power BI connect to it? They are both in the cloud! Adam shows you some things to consider and options you have! value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Power BI Top 10 / Top N Filter)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a Power BI TOP N Report , using a Top 10 or Top N Filter. As a bonus we will also compare this with another approach using the DAX TOPN Function. 👉 Download Power BI File in Video at https://web.learnpowerbi.com/download/  This is part of our complete TOP N playlist

value.title: Power BI for Mac?! Learn How to Make it Work! 🛠️
value.excerpt: Power BI for MAC? Do we have it? Do we not? I will show you step-by-step how you can use Power BI on MAC. What works, what doesn't and the workarounds. Links mentioned in the Video: •Get Power BI Mobile Apps for iOS, Android and Windows: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/mobile/ •Windows Virtual Machine

value.title: One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only in Power BI without BI Directi
value.excerpt: In a star schema design, how you can filter one dimension by another dimension. How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers. To learn more about star schema: https://radacad.com/power-bi-basics-of-modeling-star-schema-and-how-to-build-it

value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect
